attributes.name: AWS Deletion of RDS Instance or Cluster v101.0.2
attributes.description: Identifies the deletion of an Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) Aurora database cluster, global database cluster, or database instance.
author: Elastic
false_positives: Clusters or instances may be deleted by a system administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment. Cluster or instance deletions by unfamiliar users or hosts should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule.
attributes.query:
event.dataset:aws.cloudtrail and event.provider:rds.amazonaws.com and event.action:(DeleteDBCluster or DeleteGlobalCluster or DeleteDBInstance)
and event.outcome:success
attributes.setup: The AWS Fleet integration, Filebeat module, or similarly structured data is required to be compatible with this rule.
